stanza.line: That time of year thou mayst in me (a)behold(/a)
When yellow leaves or none or few do (b)hang(/b)
Upon those boughs which shake against the (a)cold(/a)
Bare ruined choirs where late the sweet birds (b)sang(/b)
In me thou seest the twilight of such (c)day(/c)
As after sunset fadeth in the (d)west(/d)
Which by and by black night doth take (c)away(/c)
Death's second self that seals up all in (d)rest(/d)
In me thou seest the glowing of such (e)fire(/e)
That on the ashes of his youth doth (f)lie(/f)
As the death-bed whereon it must (e)expire(/e)
Consumed with that which it was nourished (f)by(/f)
This thou perceiv'st which makes thy love more (g)strong(/g)
To love that well which thou must leave ere (g)long(/g)
